item.title: There's apparently a very good Mario-themed reason you should go and see Wicked: For Good this November
item.content:encoded:
If you are planning on clicking your heels together and setting off to the cinema to watch Wicked: For Good, the next film in the musical adaptation of Oz's witches Glinda and Elphaba, you may also get a first proper peep at another famous duo.

According to insider accounts @MyTimeToShineH and @TheWickedSource, a trailer for The Super Mario Galaxy Movie - which is to say, the upcoming sequel to 2023's hugely successful The Super Mario Bros. Movie - will be attached to screenings of Wicked: For Good, which is set to release on 21st November.

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

The Mario movie sequel was first teased for a 2026 release back in March of last year. At this time, we were told the next film in the franchise will "broaden Mario's world further", though further details were kept largely under wraps. Following this, Toad voice actor Keegan-Michael Key teased the film would feature an "intriguing" setting alongside "old favourite" characters and "really deep cuts", but again stopped short of revealing too much.

Then, just this September, Nintendo gave us a better idea of just how much broader this film's setting will be, when it announced the official title as The Super Mario Galaxy Movie. Perhaps later this month we will get a look at Rosalina, who surely will make an appearance in the film. I mean, Lumalee popped up in the first Mario Bros. film, so was this all a bit of foreshadowing? Well, there's potentially not much longer until we find out, with some now hoping Ariana Grande will voice Rosalina.

Along with a Mario sequel, Nintendo also has a live-action Legend of Zelda film in the works. Earlier this year, the studio announced Link and Zelda will be played by Benjamin Evan Ainsworth and Bo Bragason.

For more on the upcoming Zelda film, be sure to check out Christian Donlan's feature: Does Link's human face in the Zelda movie make anyone else feel a little... odd?

item.title: Arc Raiders has an impressive 2025 roadmap, and it's bringing a new map, new events, and other game-changers
item.content:encoded:
Arc Raiders now has an official roadmap for the rest of 2025, and considering there's only two months left in the year, it's slammed full of a substantial amount of new experiences for players to try out.

Initially posted by the Arc Raiders social media accounts, the Arc Raiders roadmap reveals that in November's 'North Line' update, we'll gain access to a new map: Stella Montis. There'll also be two new Arc enemies, a community-unlock event, as well as new quests and items.

As for December, the ‘Cold Snap’ update will bring the new snowfall map condition, the ‘Flickering Flames’ event, more new quests, a new raider deck for players to progress through, as well as the game's first departure window (or, in common parlance, an optional character reset).

Now, some of these additions remain largely mysterious, we don't know what the community-unlock event actually entails as of writing, but even with these gaps in knowledge that's at least one major thing added to the game each month. That is, it's safe to say, a huge amount of new content coming to Arc Raiders so soon after release.

It's a similar cadence to what Embark Studios brought to The Finals, which had some manner of in-game event or other twist on the formula every few weeks or so. Whether it can keep the strong momentum going for Arc Raiders remains to be seen, but given it's performing exceptionally well for an extraction shooter so far, things are certainly looking up for the game.

If you've not jumped in yet, why not read Eurogamer's preview of the game, which opens with the following: "There's a rare experience with video games when an entire genre just clicks for you. A moment when the appeal makes sense. Crawling onto an elevator with a backpack full of loot, hastily initiating the extraction sequence with seconds left to live, Arc Raiders did exactly that. It let off a firework in my head. How was I ever not a fan of this?"

Related topics


https://www.eurogamer.net/arc-raiders-has-an-impressive-2025-roadmap-and-its-bringing-a-new-map-new-events-and-other-game-changers
